resources:
Delhi Tour Guide Monument Restros Markets Malls NightLife
Red Fort Netaji Subhash Marg, Lal Qila, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi 110006 The Red Fort is a historic fort in the city of Delhi in India that served as the main residence of the Mughal Emperors. Emperor Shah Jahan commissioned construction of the Red Fort on 12 May 1638, when he decided to shift his capital from Agra to Delhi. 011 2327 7705 Timings:
Monday Closed
Tuesday - Sunday
9:30am - 4:30pm
Closed on National Holidays
Qutub Minar Seth Sarai, Mehrauli, New Delhi, Delhi 110030 The Qutb Minar, also spelled as Qutub Minar and Qutab Minar, is a minaret and "victory tower" that forms part of the Qutb complex. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site in the Mehrauli area of New Delhi, India. 011 2469 8431 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
7:00am - 5:00am
Closed on National Holidays
India Gate Rajpath, India Gate, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 The India Gate is a war memorial located astride the Rajpath, on the eastern edge of the "ceremonial axis" of New Delhi, formerly called Kingsway. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
12:00am - 12:00pm
Closed on National Holidays
Humayun's Tomb Mathura Road Opposite, Hazrat Nizamuddin Aulia Dargah, Mathu ra Rd, Nizamuddin, Nizamuddin East, New Delhi, Delhi 110013 Humayun's tomb is the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun in Delhi, India. The tomb was commissioned by Humayun's first wife and chief consort, Empress Bega Begum, in 1558, and designed by Mirak Mirza Ghiyas and his son, Sayyid Muhammad, Persia n architects chosen by her. 011 2435 5275 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
6:00am - 6:00pm
Safdarjung's Tomb Airforce Golf Course, Delhi Race Club, New Delhi, Delhi 110021 Safdarjung's Tomb is a sandstone and marble mausoleum in D elhi, India. It was built in 1754 in the late Mughal Empire style for Nawab Safdarjung. The monument has an ambience of spaciousness and an imposing presence with its domed and arched red brown and white coloured structures. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
7:00am - 5:00pm
Rashtrapati Bhawan Rashtrapati Bhawan, President's Estate, New Delhi, Delhi 110004 The Rashtrapati Bhavan Presidential Palace\;originally Viceroy's House and later Government House is the official residence of the President of India at the western end of Rajpath in New Delhi, India. Rashtrapati Bhavan may refer to only the 340-room main building that has the president's official residence, including reception halls, guest rooms and offices, also called the mansion 011 2301 5321 Timings:
Monday - Wednesday
Closed
Thursday - Sunday
9:00am - 4:00pm
Purana Qila Mathura Rd, Near Delhi Zoo, New Delhi, Delhi 110003 Purana Qila, Hindustani for "Old Fort" also formerly called Shergarh and Sher Fort is one of the oldest forts in Delhi, India. It is located near the expansive Pragati Maidan exhibition ground and is separated from the Dhyanchand Stadium by the Mathura Road, Delhi. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
7:00am - 5:00pm
Jama Masjid Jama Masjid Rd, Jama Masjid, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi 110006 The Masjid-i Jehan-Numa, commonly known as the Jama Masjid of Delhi, is one of the largest mosques in India. It was built by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan between 1650 and 1656, and inaugurated by its first Imam, Syed Abdul Ghafoor Shah Bukhari. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday - Friday
7:00am - 12:00pm
1:30pm - 6:30pm
Parliament House Sansad Marg, Gokul Nagar, Janpath, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 The Parliament of India (IAST: Bhāratīya Sansad) is the supreme legislative body of the Republic of India. It is a bicameral legislature composed of the President of India and the two houses: the Rajya Sabha (Council of States) and the Lok Sabha (House of the People). The President in his role as head of legislature has full powers to summon and prorogue either house of Parliament or to dissolve Lok Sabha. The president can exercise these powers only upon the advice of the Prime Minister and his Union Council of Ministers. 011 2303 4632 Timings:
Monday - Friday
11:00am - 5:00pm
Saturday - Sunday
Closed
Tughlaqabad Fort Tughlaqabad Fort, Tughlakabad, New Delhi, Delhi 110044 Tughlaqabad Fort is a ruined fort in Delhi, built by Ghiyas -ud-din Tughlaq, the founder of Tughlaq dynasty, of the Delhi Sultanate of India in 1321, as he established the third historic city of Delhi, which was later abandoned in 1327. 011 2332 0005 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
7:00am - 5:00pm
Chatarpur Temple Chattarpur Mandir Rd, Ansal Villas, Chhatarpur, New Delhi, Delhi 110030 Chhatarpur Mandir Timings in Delhi is one of the most popular destinations for tourists and devotees alike. The temple is dedicated to Maa Katyayani, an Avatar of Durga Mata, created jointly by Shri Brahma, Vishnu, and Mahesh. This huge complex spread over 70 acres of land houses over 30 temples dedicated to various deities. Both Navratris (Ashwin and Chaitra) are celebrated in a grand manner attended by a large number of devotees. 011 2680 2925 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
4:00am - 7:00pm
Akshardham Temple Noida Mor, Pandav Nagar, New Delhi, Delhi 110092 Swaminarayan Akshardham (New Delhi) is a Hindu temple, and spiritual-cultural campus in New Delhi, India. The temple is close to the border with Noida. Also referred to as Akshardham Temple or Akshardham Delhi, the complex displays millennia of traditional and modern Hindu culture, spirituality, and architecture. 011 4344 2344 Timings:
Monday
Closed
Tuesday - Saturday
10:00am - 6:30pm
Lotus Temple Lotus Temple Rd, Bahapur, Shambhu Dayal Bagh, Kalkaji, New Delhi, Delhi 110019 The Lotus Temple, located in Delhi, India, is a Baháʼí House of Worship that was dedicated in December 1986. Notable for its flowerlike shape, it has become a prominent attraction in the city. Like all Houses of Worship, the Lotus Temple is open to all, regardless of religion or any other qualification. 011 2644 4029 Timings:
Monday
Closed
Tuesday - Sunday
9:00am - 7:00pm (Summers)
9:00am - 5:30pm (Winters)
Bangla Sahib Gurudwara Baba Kharak Singh Rd, Hanuman Road Area, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 Gurudwara Bangla Sahib is one of the most prominent Sikh gurdwara , or Sikh house of worship, in Delhi, India, and known for its association with the eighth Sikh Guru, Guru Har Krishan, as well as the holy river inside its complex, known as the "Sarovar." 011 2334 0177 Timings:
Open 24 hours
Bercos E-42/43, Rajiv Chowk, Block E, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 Berco's by QBA is an ideal destination for all food lovers. The restaurant features authentic Chinese and Thai cuisine in its pocket-friendly menu. Contrasting flavours and spices are combined to bring out a sense of balance on your palate. The luxurious ambience complements the quality of the dishes. The Sauces, ingredients, and spices are specially handpicked by trained chefs. Berco's by QBA is a place where every diner finds his/her personal favorite dish from the A-la-Carte. 081305 00923 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
12:00pm - 8:00pm
Olive Bar and Kitchen Mile 6, One Style, 8, Kalka Das Marg, Seth Sarai, Mehrauli, New Delhi, Delhi 110030 Olive Qutub, is a rustic hideaway where good food, laughter, culture, and conversation come together in a delightful melting pot. Fashion, art, music and style fuse here to create an unforgettable Mediterranean mosaic. Dappled sunlight on soft armchairs. A white pebbled courtyard punctuated by bougainvillaea. Worlds collide and time stops in this Mogul mansion turned alfresco Mediterranean restaurant; home to warm and casual elegance, with its beautiful white walls, the white pebbled courtyard with a vast canopy of the Banyan tree, and the stunning star-lit tree-top terrace bar under the shadow of the Qutub Minar. 098102 35472 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
12:00pm - 9:30pm
Farzi Cafe E-38/39, Rajiv Chowk, Inner Circle, Block E, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 Taking care of hunger pangs till as late as 1:00AM, Farzi Cafe is a casual dining restaurant serving Modern Indian preparations. A highly-rated place in Connaught Place (CP), it is praised for its timely service and is a nice joint to visit when one is looking to satiate hunger pangs with tasty, hygienic food at reasonable prices. 095998 89701 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
11am - 9pm
Indian Accent The Lodhi, Lodhi Rd, CGO Complex, Pragati Vihar, New Delhi, Delhi 110003 Featured in the list of Asia’s 50 Best Restaurants, Indian Accent, is located inside The Lodhi Hotel, Lodhi Road, New Delhi. The restaurant is known for its inventive modern Indian cooking. Guests can also enjoy their favorite glass of wine along with the exotic food at this luxury dining restaurant. Indian Accent at the Lodhi has a rich and plush ambiance and is perfect for any kind of celebration with friends and family. 011 4323 5151 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
12:00pm - 8:00pm
Pind Baluchi Scindia House, 1/3, Janpath, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 Pind Balluchi is a popular chain of restaurants that serve Indian cuisine from the province of Punjab, which is known for its spicy indulgence and the rich aroma. The various ingredients and rich gravy preparation provide a soul-satisfying taste to the diners. The outlet is located in Scindia House, Janpath, Delhi. Pind Balluchi has a spacious and eluality time with families who are equally in love with authentic Indian curry dishes. 099106 29368 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
12:00pm - 11:00pm
Moti Mahal Delux M30, Greater Kailash 1 Rd, Greater Kailash-1, M Block, Market, Greater Kailash, New Delhi, Delhi 110048 Moti Mahal Delux is a chain of restaurants specializing in North Indian cuisine. The food served here is inspired by different provinces of Indian States, where the aroma changes after every few kilometers. The spicy indulgence and rich aroma surely make everyone savor the relishing taste of authentic Indian delicacies. This Restaurant offers varied dishes which are liked by one and all. The ambiance is as expressive and cheerful as the style of cooking and takes you on a fun ride. 011 2923 0480 Timings:
Monday
12:00pm - 3:30pm
7:00pm - 12:00am
Tuesday
Closed
Wednesday - Sunday
12:00pm - 3:30pm
7:00pm - 12:00am
Hauz Khas Social 9A12, Hauz Khas Fort Rd, Deer Park, New Delhi, Delhi 110016 Hauz Khas Social blends the best of both worlds, you can enjoy good music and food at the same place. This is the perfect place for people to have fun and unwind after a hectic day at work. Social is an all-day café and bar where you can work and play with fun drinks and comfort food. It's an urban hangout place that is designed to take you offline while still keeping you connected. The extensive menu of Social offers a range of American, Continental, North Indian, and Asian dishes along with an array of drinks and exotic cocktails. Hauz Khas Social is located near the Delhi Art Gallery in Hauz Khas Village 078386 52814 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
12:00pm - 11:00pm
Ardor 2.1 55, 56 and 88, 89, Connaught Cir, Block N, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 Ardor 2.1 Restaurant and Lounge is a multi-cuisine casual dining restaurant with a classic aura paired up with a spectacular outdoor seating that pampers the various dishes being hand-picked by the trained chefs. The menu has got so much to offer in the a-la-carte. An addition to the offering is a trendy and a well-stocked bar. Ardor 2.1 Restaurant and Lounge is located in Connaught place and it stands opposite to Scindia House 98117 66888 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
12:30pm - 12:00am
Ama Cafe House no. 6, First Floor New Camp Majnu-ka-tilla, New Aruna Nagar, New Delhi, Delhi 110054 Budget Friendly Food, Price Vs Portion Ratio, Aesthetic Ambience, Pretty Cafe, Cozy Vibe, Soothing Ambience 74289 13444 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
8:00am - 9:00pm
Lord of Drinks G-72, Radial Rd Number 2, Block G, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 Lord of the Drinks is located in the heart of Delhi and is a place where you will get a variety of drinks and a lively and awesome ambience. The ambiance gives you a rustic cottage feel, credits to great interiors and furniture from Bent Chair. The spacious and luxurious outdoors won't disappoint if you want a fantastic view of Connaught Place. This place is an instant hit amongst youngsters and amongst people who wants to experience the nightlife. For all music lovers and for people who like to groove and move, there is no better place than Lord of the Drinks. 099998 27144 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
11:30am - 12:00am
Summer House Cafe 1st Aurobindo Place Market, Sri Aurobindo Marg, Hauz Khas, New Delhi, Delhi 110016 About Summer House Cafe is a specialty restaurant that is located in one of the most buzzing places in Delhi - Hauz Khas and the nearest landmark is Midland Book Shop. It is a place where you can relish every bite of carefully prepared Italian and Continental cuisines and that too at a price that is light on your pocket. The spick and span decor of the place leaves you captivating. The dedicated staff is always on its toes to make sure everything falls into place smoothly. An addition to the awesomeness is a well-set bar. Summer House Cafe is a perfect place for people who want to go to a place that is cost-effective and at the same time gives satisfactory returns. 098102 00780 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
12pm - 1am
Diggin No.1 and 2 Anand Lok Shopping Centre, opp. Gargi College, Anand Lok, New Delhi, Delhi 110049 Diggin is a specialty restaurant that is located in Anand Lok and it stands opposite to Gargi College. It is a place for people who like to stick to their favorite cuisine and do not like to experiment much. Diggin respects their choice by offering well-prepared and mouth-watering Italian cuisine along with delicious and fresh Bakery and Confectionary items. The place also holds a subtle ambiance and makes sure you land up at the same place when it comes to having your favorite cuisine in the most authentic form. An addition to the offering is the outdoor seating area available there. 011 4080 0081 Timings:
11:30pm - 8:00pm
Naivedeyam 1, Hauz Khas Village, Deer Park, Hauz Khas, New Delhi, Delhi 110016 Naivedyam is a specialty restaurant that is located in Hauz Khaz. It is a place for people who like to stick to their favorite cuisine and do not like to experiment much. Naivedyam respects their choice by offering well-prepared and mouth-watering South Indian cuisine. The place also holds a subtle ambiance and makes sure you land up at the same place when it comes to having your favorite cuisine in the most authentic form. The nearest landmark is Deer Park. 011 2696 0426 Timings:
10:00am - 11:00pm
Naturals Ice Cream\ Block L, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 Natural Ice Cream is an Ice Cream joint chain in India serving a range of flavorful ice creams. The place has been a pioneer in making artisan ice creams using only fruits, dry fruits, chocolates, milk, and sugar. Natural Ice Cream offers fresh ice creams made from natural ingredients with no synthetic flavors or essences. The menu is pocket-friendly and exclusive. Natural Ice Cream has various outlets spread all across the country. This outlet is located near Theme Music Institute in Connaught Place, Central Delhi. 83684 36163 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
10:00am - 1:00am
Select City Walk" A-3, Saket District Centre, District Centre, Sector 6, Pushp Vihar, New Delhi, Delhi 110017 Select CITYWALK is spread out over 6 lakh sq. ft. of retail space and is home to more than 175 brands. It offers the widest range of labels, we assure you – if there’s something you need, want or is a part of your wish list, your wishes will be fulfilled! Not only do we house a plethora of stores, but we also bring you a number of high-street brands to provide a lively outdoor shopping experience, numerous carts and kiosks to pick up fun, exciting products spread across the centre! 011 4211 4200 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
10:00am - 8:00pm
DLF Emporio 4, Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj II, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi, Delhi 110070 DLF Emporio has been designed as a name synonymous with luxury - offering a unique shopping experience where the accent is on exclusivity, space and aesthetics. There is simply no other place where such a wealth of designer and luxury merchandise, lifestyle products and services are showcased under one elegant roof. The nuances of luxurious serenity are going to be expressed at DLF Emporio in a way found only in the fashion capitals of the world, offering just the right kind of tasteful and sublime ambience to attract high value spenders. 011 4611 6666 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
11:00am - 9:00pm
DLF Promenade Vasant Kunj Mall Road, Vasant Kunj II, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi, Delhi 110070 Located on the Nelson Mandela road in the heart of Vasant Kunj is DLF Promenade, a mall for the trend-conscious discerning customers of Delhi and NCR. By the virtue of its offerings, DLF Promenade has earned the distinction of being the Delhi’s fashion capital. Spread over 4.6 lacs of square foot area, DLF Promenade caters to customers who are looking for a quality shopping experience coupled with a chic ambience. 011 4610 4466 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
11:00am - 11:00pm
Ambience Mall 2, Nelson Mandela Marg, Ambience Island, Vasant Kunj II, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi, Delhi 110070 All sales, stores, restaurants, offers, events, promotions at Ambience Mall Vasant Kunj. Ambience Mall, Vasant Kunj is an integrated shopping mall on the Nelson Mandela Road (part of the Outer Ring Road of New Delhi) and enroute to the International Airport. Nelson Mandela Road provides easy connectivity to other parts of New Delhi, especially the up-market areas of Vasant Vihar, West End, Shanti Niketan and Vasant Kunj. The mall is a part of the Vasant Kunj Shopping Mall Complex proposed by DDA in Delhi consisting of two other s hopping malls and Corporate Offices. The mall overlooks a 650 acre bio-diversity Park and the landscaped grounds of Jawaharlal Nehru University. The mall will offer a wide range of entertainment and recreational facilities, including four anchor stores, hypermarket, a four-screen multiplex cinema, food court, restaurants, a discotheque, a beer garden a family entertainment centre, a kids play zone, a fitness and recreation centre, and car show room. The mall has over 1800 car parking spaces and offers amenities such as wide atrium spaces, high speed elevators and escalators, multiple entry/exits and power back-ups. 81303 50002 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
10:00am - 10:00pm
DLF Place A4, Press Enclave Marg, Saket District Centre, District Centre, Sector 6, Pushp Vihar, New Delhi, Delhi 110017 The DLF Avenue Experience DLF Avenue is a distinctly different kind of mall—one that brings together shopping, dining and culture through a curated experience for the whole community. 011 4606 4444 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
11:00am - 8:00pm
DLF City Centre 191, Shaheed Udham Singh Marg, Block AP, Poorbi Shalimar Bag, Shalimar Bagh, Delhi, 110088 City Centre is situated in North Delhi, an untapped land of opportunities that comprises a populace with high purchasing power. Situated in Community Centre, Block-A, Shalimar Bagh, the City Centre is planned as one of the most modern shopping-cum-entertainment centers in North-West Delhi. 08607086391 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
10:00am - 12:00pm
Pacific Mall Najafgarh Rd, Tagore Garden, Tilak Nagar, New Delhi, Delhi 110018 At Pacific Mall, you will find a plethora of options for shopping, dining, and entertainment that impressively suit your taste and budget. Several prominent retailers from across the world join side by side to offer the finest shopping experience. Similarly, we have brought handpicked the best culinary outlets to suit your taste and budget. From a grand and luxury cinema theatre to a gaming parlour with many arcades games, and from complete vegetarian menus to non-veggies bliss, everything is under a single roof. Spread across the massive area of 600,000 sq. ft., the mall has enough to offer you a wide variety of brands. 099533 99833 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
10:00am - 8:00pm
Ansal Plaza Hudco Place, Andrews Ganj Extension, Andrews Ganj, New Delhi, Delhi 110049 Ansal plaza is the first mall of Delhi opened on 1 November’ 1999. The mall was established by Ansal properties and infrastructure Ltd. The mall is located at Andrews Ganj, on Khel Gaon Marg, in South Delhi. The mall is built in a circular fashion around an amphitheatre, where cultural events are organised from time to time. There is 45 foot high atrium with French glass curtain wall. The wall filters out ultraviolet and other harmful radiation. The mall houses many prominent brands like Adidas, Mc Donalds, Shoppers Stop, Nike, Reebok etc. There are also shops selling accessories, music and other trendy lifestyle products like Apple stores. There are numerous options available at the food court with various restaurants. There is a Big Cinema multiplex at Ansal Plaza with multiple show timings for enjoying the movies. The mall has a parking capacity of 1000 cars. 011 2625 0957 Timings\Monday - Sunday
9:30am - 9:30pm
Metro Walk Metro Walk Mall, Near Rithala Metro Station, Sector 10, Rohini, New Delhi, Delhi 110085 The place is a two story open shopping mall having several restaurants and bars. One can sit along the lake and enjoy cool air. There is a small multiple nozzle fountain at the main entrance attracting all. One can go to Adventure Island if they want water and adventure sports. 011 4704 4111 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
11:00am - 10:00pm
West Gate Mall 4-5-6, Shivaji district centre metro station, Shivaji Place, Rajouri Garden, New Delhi, Delhi 110027 This mall is one of the most Prominent Shopping and Leisure destination in the capital city. The West Gate Mall is one of the larger malls in the area of West Delhi, being one of the 5 malls located in the general area of Shivaji Place District Centre, Rajouri Garden, West Delhi. West Gate mall Rajouri Garden was developed by the Today Homes Group. This mall is a convenient one stop destination point for the localities nearby, such as Punjabi Bagh, Rajouri Garden, Tilak Nagar,Mansarovar Garden, Kirti Nagar, Paschim Vihar and Patel Nagar. Unlike other malls, the basic facilities like Washrooms are very clean, lifts and escalators are very well maintained and the premises is kept neat and tidy. 011 4550 8092 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
 10:00am - 11:00pm
Dilli Haat INA Market, Dilli Haat, Kidwai Nagar West, Kidwai Nagar, Delhi, 110023 The DILLI HAAT provides the ambience of a traditional Rural Haat or village market, but one suited for more contemporary needs. Here one sees a synthesis of crafts, food and cultural activity. This Food and Craft Bazar is a treasure house of Indian culture, handicrafts and ethnic cuisine, A unique bazaar, in the heart of the city, it displays the richness of Indian culture on a permanent basis. Step inside the complex for an altogether delightful experience by either buying inimitable ethnic wares, savouring the delicacies of different states or by simply relaxing in the evening with the entire family. 011 2611 9055 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
10:30am - 10:00pm
Janpath Market Janpath Rd, Janpath, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 Here you get to do the best of street shopping. You will mostly find small kiosks selling all kinds of cotton clothes and curios. The clothes are generally export-surplus garments and are sold dirt-cheap. There's lots of silver and artificial jewellery studded with semi-precious stones available here. Refugees who came after the Partition and Tibetans who came when China invaded Tibet settled here as traders. Shopping here requires a couple of skills. One, you must have the ability to distinguish the fake from the genuine. Two, you must know and practice the art of bargaining patiently. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
11:00am - 9:00pm
Khan Market 61A, Khan Market, Rabindra Nagar, New Delhi, Delhi 110003 Classy and posh, Khan Market is a favourite of the expat and diplomatic community. It was originally allocated as seed land to immigrants from the North-West Frontier Province after the partition of India. Today, it is a popular shopping destination in Delhi. It is a large U-shaped market with two parallel ‘U’s and some extensions. You will find excellent book shops, up-market boutiques, opticians, grocers, tailors, brand showrooms, lifestyle stores, etc here and There are also a couple of boutiques selling up-market household furnishings. Across the road are shops that specialize mainly in lighting. You will also find many eating joints: cafes, restaurants, bakeries and street-food corners. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
10:00am - 12:00am
Sarojini Market Sarojini Nagar, New Delhi - 110023 At the Sarojini Nagar Market you get fashionable clothes at affordable prices. Export-surplus garments as well as rejected export clothing come to this market at throwaway prices. That is why product of even reputed brands available here at cheap prices. But don't expect trial or changing rooms at street-side shops. Besides, use your art of haggling. The market remains closed on Mondays. There are different areas within the market. Babu Market houses several sweet shops. The many shoe shops in the vicinity of the market also catch the eye. Subzi Mundi offers the freshest and choicest fruits and fresh vegetables. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday
Closed
Tuesday - Sunday
11:00am - 9:00pm
Chandni Chowk Market 2573, Nai Sarak, Raghu Ganj, Roshanpura, Old Delhi, New Delhi, Delhi 110006 This old market has retained its charm and historic value over the year. It was built in the 17th century by the Mughal ruler Shah Jahan, opposite Lal Quila and close to Fatehpuri Mosque. There is a rather interesting story scribbled in the history on how the place got its name. There was a pool at the centre of place, that reflected the moon. Hence, it was named as Chandni Chowk or Moonlight Square. Chandni Chowk is a shoppers paradise in true sense. The narrow streets of Chandni Chowk have shops that are struggling for space. However, shopping at Chandni Chowk is different level of fun. The kind of variety you get there is unmatchable and that too, at the most reasonable prices. The market is divided into several narrow streets where one can get variety of clothes, jewellry, candles, perfumes, lifestyle items, et al. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday - Saturday
9:00am - 8:00pm
Sunday
Closed
Central Market(Lajpat Nagar Market) Lajpat Nagar II, Lajpat Nagar, New Delhi, Delhi 110024
Lajpat Nagar is a popular shopping area where you can get whatever you desire - accessories, clothes, footwear, bags, etc. The garments at Hakoba range from saris and salwar kameezes for women to kurtas and kurtis for both men and women. The Lucknowi embroidery, which is mostly done in white-coloured threads, is breathtaking and of very high quality. Karan and Nasir have been revolutionizing the way men dress. RCKC has carved a niche for itself in the international market with labels like Anamika and RISA by Abhijeet Khanna. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday
Closed
Tuesday - Sunday
10:00am - 9:00pm
Canaught PLace Market Hanuman Road Area, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 When it came into being, the sprawling circular market was the largest of its kind in India. The British believed that the horseshoe-shaped market would prove lucky for the shoppers and the shopkeepers both. This market has two circles. The Inner Circle consists of Blocks A to F. The important shops and showrooms here include Adidas Originals , Allen Solly, Bentley, Bon Ton, Cantabil, Gas, Johnson Watch Company, Kalpana, Lee, Louis Philippe , Neelkanth Jewellers, Nike, Orra, Park Avenue, Pepe, Proline and Fila, Roopchand Jewellers, Snowhite Square, Wills Lifestyle. Mohanlal Sons promises to give you ready or tailored attires to suit every occasion. Known for its quality and good service, you will find here a wide range of shirts, trousers, jackets, suits, kurtas and sherwanis. The Outer Circle consists of Blocks G to P. Showrooms like Digjam, Lacoste, Omega, Rado, RL Exports and TAG Heuer lie in this circle. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
10:00am - 11:00pm
Karol Bagh Market Block 1, WEA, Karol Bagh, New Delhi, Delhi 110060 Karol Bagh is a shopper's delight for you can find virtually everything here. Ajmal Khan Road has long been famous for inexpensive readymades, cotton yarn and embroidered garments. But now international labels have also become equally familiar. At Arya Samaj Road you can buy second-hand books. Bank Street has a row of shops displaying gold jewellery. Ghaffar Market is famous for imported goods. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday
Closed
Tuesday - Sunday
10:00am - 10:00pm
Paharganj Market Multani Dhanda, Paharganj, New Delhi, Delhi 110055 011 2336 5358 As you step out of the New Delhi Railway Station and cross the road, you stand at the entrance of Paharganj Main Bazaar. Stretching for about a kilometre, it is a bargainer's paradise. Chaotic, noisy and dirty, the market is only for shoppers who are rough and tough. The whole Main Bazaar is lined with shops full to the brim with books, music, jewellery, bags, clothes, shoes, incense, textiles, wooden statues, and handicrafts. Shanti Handloom and other textile shops offer bags, bed spreads, cushion covers, wall hangings, etc. The jewellery shops sell handmade beaded necklaces and bangles in every shape, size and colour. Carved wooden statues of gods and goddesses, brass wares and decorations are available among handicrafts. Prayer Incense Worldwide specializes in incense sticks, incense cones and Indian tea. Even books, both new and second-hand, are available. Timings:
Monday
Closed
Tuesday - Sunday
10:00am - 9:00pm
Palika Bazaar Canaught Place, New Delhi - 110001 This underground, air-conditioned market located below the inner circle of Connaught Place was set up in the late 1970s. It is especially famous for cheap electronic goods and clothes. From footwear to clothing to nightwear to perfumes to accessories to electronic gadgets to DVDs and CDs, you will get a wide range of products in this massive market. You may also buy curios and small knick-knacks to take back home as souvenirs. There are hundreds of shops in Palika Bazaar. It is estimated to have some 15,000 people within its confines at any given time and also attracts many foreign tourists. Although bargaining is the mantra for shopping anywhere in Delhi, it must be followed here rigorously. 011 2336 5358 Timings:
Monday - Sunday
9:00am - 5:00pm
Sunday
Closed
Books Market Asaf Ali Rd, Chatta lal Miya, Chandni Mahal, Daryaganj, New Delhi, Delhi 110002 Be it the latest best-seller or an out-of-print book, Delhi is a hot destination for buying books. Stretching for more than a kilometre, the Daryaganj Old Book Market is often referred to as the world's largest weekly book market. It is organised every Sunday. Most of the books available here are used. Besides the throwaway price, the availability of a wide variety and out-of-print, difficult-to-find books draws buyers here. From fiction to medical sciences, architecture to cookery, comics to atlases, classics to magazines, and management to hobbies, name any genre and you can find it here. 011 2336 5358 Timings
Sunday

Meena Bazaar Red Fort, New Delhi - 110006 Located between Jama Masjid and Dariba Kalan is the ancient market Meena Bazaar in Delhi. Just below the massive stairs of the Jama Masjid is the bieatiful market place. From Jama Masjid to Khari Baoli, from Chitli Qabar to Balli Maran, Delhi evokes a medieval charm and elegance. The Bazaar was built in the1970’s. The area comprises of a host of shops on both sides selling paans, burqas (veils worn by Muslim women), caps and pictures of famous Islamic religious places. Other exotic items like embroidered caps for Muslim men, local cosmetics, pictures and posters of sacred places are available at the Meena Bazaar. You can satiate your appetite with toothsome Indian non-vegetarians cuisines at the small food stalls and dotting the area. 011 2336 5358 Timings:

Special attention to quality and perfection is evident from the collaboration Kitty Su has with eminent music biggies like MOS and VOID. Hybrid 54, Tolstoy Rd, Atul Grove Road, Janpath, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 The hybrid café – like the hybrid car – operates on two levels to seamlessly achieve one objective. The hybrid car uses both internal power combustion and electric to get from A to B. One source of power takes over when the other is lacking, but importantly, they back each other up. Instead of power, the hybrid café has dual income streams which create a different form of momentum, in the form of cash flow and a tangible point of difference to draw in customers. You have the main source of income from the café business and a secondary income from the other business. The nature of the two businesses can be vastly different, but as with the hybrid car, they must support each other. 9999488223 Timings:
Monday - Sunday

At TC Bar and Restaurant, they celebrate the real flavors of the specialty cuisine that has become fashionable and popular all around the world. Monkey Bar Local Shopping Complex 11 Next to Mini Cooper Showroom, Vasant Kunj Marg, Pocket B-C, Sector C, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi, Delhi 110070 It’s fun, it’s quirky, it’s inspired by pubs the world over! Monkey Bar ( part of the Olive group of restaurants), India’s first and favourite gastro-pub brings you more of everything you love. The menu is non-conformist and quirky, bringing together all the signature dishes that have made it a delight for food lovers; as well as lots more small and large plates. Expect to find regional Indian, homely and familiar flavours, given an unconventional and playful twist, comforting pub grub inspired from different cuisines, thin crust pizzas, burgers and a bunch of refreshing cocktails with a fun twist. The emphasis, as always is on the fresh, innovative and affordable-in a cool, yet, laid back atmosphere. 011 4109 5155 Timings:

Nestled on the third floor in J-2/6 B, , BK Dutt Market, Rajouri Garden, New Delhi the place has a pleasing Bollywood aura with really attractive interiors and a fantastic ambience. It has two floors of seating both indoor and a terrace. There are exciting Bollywood posters as well as famous dialogues of Bollywood actors pasted on the walls. My Bar HQ N 49, 2nd Floor, Radial Road Number 1, near Dominos, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001 My Bar Headquarters is one of the cheapest bars in the city without being seedy or placed in a shady locality. Interiors, location, ambience, all is top-notch. Even if budget-friendly, the bar keeps an impressive bar menu filled with a good range of wines, beers, cognac, tequila, brandy, vodka, rum, gin, whisky, scotch and cocktails. They have good deals frequently, keep an eye open for that. Drivers can quench their thirst with some delicious mocktails and smoothies on offer. Grub menu is a mix of North Indian and Chinese, two of our favourite cuisines. Nibble on a series of appetizers before tackling the mains course.
